content: pamela a pattern designed by sarah walpole october 2023 pamela is a crochet doll made in imitation of eighteenth century dolls she requires a pair of 10mm doll eyes i got mine from graciesdollyshop on etsy you could of course skip these and embroider the eyes 4 ply yarn is used i have noted the yarns i used but they are from my stash and may now be discontinued the clothes are made separately i have stitched them on but they could very easily be made to take on and off just tie the skirt waist with a bow use hooks and eyes or lacing over the stomacher and elastic in the cap 1 i used world of wool bamboo 4 ply alt yarn and a 1 5mm hook the doll is worked in spirals using a small safety-pin to mark the last stitch of each round it is made almost entirely of what the british call double_crochet and the americans single_crochet where there is simply a number in the instructions it refers to the number of these stitches just occasionaly a half-treble aka half-double is used and this is referred to as h so 3h means 3 of these and increase h means two of them in one stitch abbreviations increase work two stitches into one space decrease work two stitches together 2 instuctions number of stitches make 6 stitches into magic loop 6 increase in every stitch 12 increase 1 all round 18 increase 2 all round 24 plain 24 increase 3 30 8 rounds plain 30 for eyes 9 ch5 miss 5 2 ch5 miss 5 9 30 plain working 5 sts over chains rather than into 30 them 2 rounds plain 30 for nose 16 4 chain turn and work slip_stitch 30 round post of st between eyes 3 over chain and continue round plain put safety-pin into last st to prevent unravelling while you cut a small piece of fabric as backing for eyes place it inside head and mark with pencil where eyes should lie then glue them on glue lightly between and to sides of eyes to hold fabric in place allow to dry thoroughly before continueing to crochet 3 decrease all round stuff 24 2 decrease all round 18 plain stuff
